ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Display the filters applied to a dataset

DESC.PARA: The show_filter command displays the filters which are currently applied to the data.

LIST.ITEM: id - the id of the dataset to use; default is to show filter information for all available datasets.
outfile - name of the file in which to store the information

DESC.PARA: The behavior of the screen output is determined by the user's $PAGER environment variable setting, which is usually a variant of "more." To disable paging within show_all() - i.e. print the entire contents, even if it scrolls offscreen - change this setting to "cat" before starting Sherpa:
DESC.VERBATIM:
unix% setenv PAGER cat
unix% sherpa

DESC.PARA: Print the filter information to the screen for all datasets.
Write the filter information for dataset id=2 to the file "sherpa.filter", clobbering any existing file with the same name.

BUGS.PARA: See the bugs pages on the Sherpa website for an up-to-date listing of known bugs.
